pageContext.claim: “We're taking the remnants of Obamacare, and working very hard, so the premiums don't go up like they were under him -- you know that used to go up 215 percent, 230 percent. Now the raises of the premiums are very small by comparison.”
pageContext.analysis: Health care costs in the Obamacare exchanges have stabilized either declining or increasing slightly. But premiums are still higher than they would have been if the individual mandate had not been repealed and if markets had not faced the uncertainty of Congress's looming repeal and replace promises. The administration has embraced reinsurance which has helped but even then, it's a stretch to take credit for fixing a problem the administration exacerbated.
